channel.title: Look at this and try to help!
channel.description: Hello readers, I have a small problem when updating my client.java on my server. I use homiescape as a source, I've edited some stuff on my client.java such as the message when you log in, the rules etc. But when I play the client provided, it doesn't change. But when I edit NPCs that works. Why isn't my client.java working? Please help. :confused:

item.title: Look at this and try to help!
item.dc:creator: @C4ll3r C4ll3r
item.description:
@C4ll3r wrote:

This clients work …
For JDK 6.0.14
and others…

Read full topic

item.title: Look at this and try to help!
item.dc:creator: @C4ll3r C4ll3r
item.description:
@C4ll3r wrote:

Maybe u can use my compiler…

[code]@echo off

:def
color 0F

:main
cls
title ~Java~ and Bloody4Scape’s Compiler
echo :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
echo :: Welcome to ~Java~'s and Bloody4Scape’s Ultimate Compiler!
echo ::
echo :: Choose one of the options below by entering
echo :: the commands listed under Main options.
echo ::
echo :: Need Some Help or Assistance with this Compiler?
echo :: Private Message ~Java~ or Bloody4Scape on - www.silabsoft.org/index.php
echo :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
echo :::: Main options:
echo :::: com = Compile your server.
echo :::: run = Run your server.
echo :::: aur = Runs your server with autorestart.
echo :::: bac = Backup your server files.
echo ::::
echo :::: Other options;
echo :::: set = Change settings.
echo :::: loc = Location list (co-ordinates)
echo :::: upd = Updates
echo :::: cmd = Command generator
echo :::: cre = Credits
echo :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
echo ::
set /p mainc=:: Choice:

if %mainc%==com goto com
if %mainc%==run goto run
if %mainc%==aur goto aur
if %mainc%==bac goto bac

if %mainc%==set goto set
if %mainc%==loc goto loc
if %mainc%==upd goto upd
if %mainc%==cmd goto cmd
if %mainc%==cre goto cre

if %mainc%==COM goto com
if %mainc%==RUN goto run
if %mainc%==AUR goto aur
if %mainc%==BAC goto bac

if %mainc%==SET goto set
if %mainc%==LOC goto loc
if %mainc%==UPD goto upd
if %mainc%==CMD goto cmd
if %mainc%==CRE goto cre

goto main

:com
cls
title Compiling…
echo :: Preparing for compile…
echo :: Auto-setting envriomental variables…
echo ::
goto com2

:com2
title MedievalProject Source Compiling…
echo :: Scanning for latest JDK version…
echo ::
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_05\BIN” (GOTO COM07)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_10\BIN” (GOTO COM06)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_09\BIN” (GOTO COM05)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_07\BIN” (GOTO COM04)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_06\BIN” (GOTO COM03)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.5.0\BIN” (GOTO COM02)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0\BIN” (GOTO COM01)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_12\BIN” (GOTO COM07)
goto comerrorxxx
:COM07
echo :: Found JDK 1.6.0_12
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin
echo :: Results:
javac *.java
echo :: Thank You for Compiling!
pause
goto main

:COM06
echo :: Found JDK 1.6.0_10
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin
echo :: Results:
javac *.java
echo :: Thank you for compiling!
pause
goto main

:COM05
echo :: Found JDK 1.6.0_09
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_09\bin
echo :: Results:
javac *.java
echo :: Thank you for compiling!
pause
goto main

:COM04
echo :: Found JDK 1.6.0_07
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin
echo :: Results:
javac *.java
echo :: Thank you for compiling!
pause
goto main

:COM03
echo :: Found JDK 1.6.0_06
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin
echo :: Results:
javac *.java
echo :: Thank you for compiling!
pause
goto main

:COM2
echo :: Found JDK 1.5.0
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0\bin
echo :: Results:
javac *.java
echo :: Thank you for compiling!
pause
goto main

:COM01
echo :: Found JDK 1.6.0
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin
echo :: Results:
javac *.java
echo :: Thank you for compiling!
pause
goto main

:COMERRORXXX
echo :: No version of JDK 1.6/1.5. was detected. Please install it at www.Java.com
pause
goto main

:run
cls
title MedievalProject Running…
echo :: Port:
echo :: 43594
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_05\BIN” (GOTO RUN07)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_10\BIN” (GOTO RUN06)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_09\BIN” (GOTO RUN05)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_07\BIN” (GOTO RUN04)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_06\BIN” (GOTO RUN03)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.5.0\BIN” (GOTO RUN02)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0\BIN” (GOTO RUN01)
:RUN07
echo :: Scanning for JDK Version…
echo :: Running MedievalProject Source using JDK 1.6.0_05…
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_05\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_05\bin
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
echo :: Failed to Run MedievalProject! Contact ~Java~ on Silabsoft!
pause
goto main
:RUN06
echo :: Running using JDK 1.6.0_10…
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
echo :: Failed to Run MedievalProject! Contact ~Java~ on Silabsoft!
pause
goto main
:RUN05
echo :: Running using JDK 1.6.0_09…
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_09\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_09\bin
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
echo :: Failed to Run MedievalProject! Contact ~Java~ on Silabsoft!
pause
goto main
:RUN04
echo :: Running using JDK 1.6.0_07…
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
echo :: Failed to Run MedievalProject! Contact ~Java~ on Silabsoft!
pause
goto main
:RUN03
echo :: Running using JDK 1.6.0_06…
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
echo :: Failed to Run MedievalProject! Contact ~Java~ on Silabsoft!
pause
goto main
:RUN02
echo :: Running using JDK 1.5.0…
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.5.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0\bin
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
echo :: Failed!
pause
goto main
:RUN01
echo :: Running using JDK 1.6.0…
SET CLASSPATH=Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
echo :: Failed to Run MedievalProject! Contact ~Java~ on Silabsoft!
pause
cls
goto main

:bac
:backup
cls
title Backing up files…
echo :: Backing up files…
if not exist Backup mkdir Backup
if not exist Backup\characters mkdir Backup\characters
if not exist Backup\connectedFrom mkdir Backup\connectedFrom
if not exist Backup\data mkdir Backup\data
if not exist Backup\flagged mkdir Backup\flagged
if not exist Backup\logs mkdir Backup\logs
if not exist Backup\moreinfo mkdir Backup\moreinfo
if not exist Backup\savedGames mkdir Backup\savedGames
Echo Starting Backup Copy
copy /V /Y /A *.txt .\Backup
copy /V /Y /A *.java .\Backup
copy /V /Y /A *.class .\Backup
copy /V /Y /A *.cfg .\Backup
copy /V /Y /A *.bat .\Backup
copy /V /Y /A bans .\Backup\bans
copy /V /Y /A characters .\Backup\characters
copy /V /Y /A characters .\Backup\characters
copy /V /Y /A connectedFrom .\Backup\connectedFrom
copy /V /Y /A data .\Backup\data
copy /V /Y /A flagged .\Backup\flagged
copy /V /Y /A logs .\Backup\logs
copy /V /Y /A moreinfo .\Backup\moreinfo
copy /V /Y /A savedGames .\Backup\savedGames
echo :: Done.
pause
cls
goto main

:set
cls
echo :: Enter one of the following to change background colour.
echo :: B0 = Black
echo :: B1 = Blue
echo :: B2 = Green
echo :: B3 = Cyan
echo :: B4 = Red
echo :: B5 = Purple
echo :: B6 = Yellow
echo :: B7 = White
echo.
echo :: Enter one of the following to change text colour.
echo :: T0 = Black
echo :: T1 = Blue
echo :: T2 = Green
echo :: T3 = Cyan
echo :: T4 = Red
echo :: T5 = Purple
echo :: T6 = Yellow
echo :: T7 = White

set /p s=:: Choice:

if %s%== B0 (set b=0)
if %s%== B1 (set b=1)
if %s%== B2 (set b=2)
if %s%== B3 (set b=3)
if %s%== B4 (set b=4)
if %s%== B5 (set b=5)
if %s%== B6 (set b=6)
if %s%== B7 (set b=F)
if %s%== T0 (set t=0)
if %s%== T1 (set t=1)
if %s%== T2 (set t=2)
if %s%== T3 (set t=3)
if %s%== T4 (set t=4)
if %s%== T5 (set t=5)
if %s%== T6 (set t=6)
if %s%== T7 (set t=F)

color %b%%t%
pause
cls
goto main

:loc
cls
echo :: Below is a list of locations with their coordinates.
echo ::
echo :: Varrock - 3210 3424
echo :: Falador - 2964 3378
echo :: Lumbridge - 3222 3218
echo :: Camelot - 2757 3477
echo :: East Ardougne 2662 3305
echo :: West Ardougne 2529 3307
echo :: Al Kharid 3293 3174
echo :: Khalphite Lair 3226 3107
echo :: Yannille 2606 3093
echo :: Tutorial Island 3094 3107
echo :: Barbarian Village 3082 3420
echo :: Entrana 2834 3335
echo :: Heroes Guild 2902 3510
echo :: Rangers Guild 2658 3439
echo :: Catherby 2813 3447
echo :: Seers Village 2708 3492
echo :: Fishing Guild 2603 3414
echo :: Isafdar 2241 3238
pause
cls
goto main

:upd
cls
echo :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
echo :: Latest updates:
echo ::
echo :: 1) Added Location list.
echo :: 2) Fixed backup commands.
echo :: 3) Added settings option.
echo :: 4) Fixed backup to cover more file types.
echo :: 5) Added autorestarter. This was incredibly difficult for me to do.
echo :: 6) Added command generator.
echo :: 7) Auto-sets enviromental variables when compiling.
echo :: 8) Released On Mopar Forums
echo :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
pause
cls
goto main

:cmd
:Star
Set /p CmdName=Command Input?
Set /p RUSure=Are you sure you want the commands input: %CmdName%(yes,no)?
If %RUSure%==no GOTO Star
If not Exist CommandsFolder MD Commands Folder
Echo else if(command.equalsignorecase("%CmdName%")) >> “.\Commands%CmdName% Command.txt”
Echo { >> “.\Commands%CmdName% Command.txt”
cls
set /p AY=addItem(yes,no)?
If %AY%==YES Goto addItem
If %AY%==yes Goto addItem
If %AY%==no Goto endCode
If %AY%==NO Goto endCode
:addItem
cls
set /p ID=ItemID?
cls
set /p Amount=Amount Of that Item?
cls
echo addItem(%ID%,%Amount%); >> “.\Commands%CmdName% Command.txt”
Set /P AT=Add item, add tele or finish command.(AI,T,End)
If %AT%==ai GOTO addItem
If %AT%==Ai GOTO addItem
If %AT%==AI GOTO addItem
If %AT%==aI GOTO addItem
If %AT%==T GOTO Tele
If %AT%==t GOTO Tele
If %AT%==end GOTO endCode
If %AT%==END GOTO endCode
If %AT%==EnD GOTO endCode
If %AT%==eNd GOTO endCode
If %AT%==ENd GOTO endCode
If %AT%==enD GOTO endCode
if %AT%==End Goto endcode
if %type%==* goto error
echo.
goto error
:error
cls
echo Commands invalid. Only use commands from the menu.
pause
goto menu
:endCode
cls
Echo } >> “.\Commands%CmdName% Command.txt”
Set /p Again=Make Another (yes, No)?
If %Again%==yes GOTO Star
If %Again%==no goto fin
If %Again%==YES GOTO Star
If %Again%==NO goto fin
:Tele
cls
Set /P X=XCoord Tele?
Set /P Y=YCoord Tele?
Echo teleportToX = %X% >> “.\Commands%CmdName% Command.txt”
Echo teleportToY = %Y% >> “.\Commands%CmdName% Command.txt”
Set /P AT=addItem Or Another Tele(not Used In Same Command Usually(AI,T,End)
If %AT%==ai GOTO addItem
If %AT%==Ai GOTO addItem
If %AT%==AI GOTO addItem
If %AT%==aI GOTO addItem
If %AT%==T GOTO Tele
If %AT%==t GOTO Tele
If %AT%==end GOTO endCode
If %AT%==END GOTO endCode
If %AT%==EnD GOTO endCode
If %AT%==eNd GOTO endCode
If %AT%==ENd GOTO endCode
If %AT%==enD GOTO endCode
if %AT%==End Goto endcode

:fin
echo Command creation complete. Find it in the commands folder.
pause
cls
goto main

:aur
cls
echo :: Have you already set up your autorestarter? (Y/N)

set /p ans=:: Answer:

if %ans%==y goto ansyes
if %ans%==n goto ansno
goto main

:ansyes
cls
call autorestart.bat
echo Not Found!
pause
goto main

:ansno
cls
echo :: How long between auto restarts?
set /p hlb=:: (10min, 12min, 14min, 16min, 18min, 20min):

if %hlb%==10min goto min10
if %hlb%==12min goto min12
if %hlb%==14min goto min14
if %hlb%==16min goto min16
if %hlb%==18min goto min18
if %hlb%==20min goto min20

:min10
del ProcessKiller.bat
del Autorestart.bat
del Runner.bat

echo :start >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo PING 1.1.1.1 -n 1 -w 600000 >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo tskill java >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo start call runner >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo goto start >> ProcessKiller.bat

echo java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server >> Runner.bat
echo exit >> Runner.bat

echo @echo off >> Autorestart.bat
echo :start >> Autorestart.bat
echo Start call “Runner.bat” >> Autorestart.bat
echo call “ProcessKiller.bat” >> Autorestart.bat
echo pause >> Autorestart.bat
echo goto start >> Autorestart.bat

goto donexd

:min12
del ProcessKiller.bat
del Autorestart.bat
del Runner.bat

echo :start >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo PING 1.1.1.1 -n 1 -w 720000 >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo tskill java >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo start call runner >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo goto start >> ProcessKiller.bat

echo java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server >> Runner.bat
echo exit >> Runner.bat

echo @echo off >> Autorestart.bat
echo :start >> Autorestart.bat
echo Start call “Runner.bat” >> Autorestart.bat
echo call “ProcessKiller.bat” >> Autorestart.bat
echo pause >> Autorestart.bat
echo goto start >> Autorestart.bat
goto donexd

:min14
del ProcessKiller.bat
del Autorestart.bat
del Runner.bat

echo :start >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo PING 1.1.1.1 -n 1 -w 840000 >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo tskill java >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo start call runner >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo goto start >> ProcessKiller.bat

echo java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server >> Runner.bat
echo exit >> Runner.bat

echo @echo off >> Autorestart.bat
echo :start >> Autorestart.bat
echo Start call “Runner.bat” >> Autorestart.bat
echo call “ProcessKiller.bat” >> Autorestart.bat
echo pause >> Autorestart.bat
echo goto start >> Autorestart.bat

goto donexd

:min16
del ProcessKiller.bat
del Autorestart.bat
del Runner.bat

echo :start >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo PING 1.1.1.1 -n 1 -w 960000 >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo tskill java >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo start call runner >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo goto start >> ProcessKiller.bat

echo java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server >> Runner.bat
echo exit >> Runner.bat

echo @echo off >> Autorestart.bat
echo :start >> Autorestart.bat
echo Start call “Runner.bat” >> Autorestart.bat
echo call “ProcessKiller.bat” >> Autorestart.bat
echo pause >> Autorestart.bat
echo goto start >> Autorestart.bat
goto donexd

:min18
del ProcessKiller.bat
del Autorestart.bat
del Runserver.bat

echo :start >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo PING 1.1.1.1 -n 1 -w 1080000 >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo tskill java >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo start call runner >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo goto start >> ProcessKiller.bat

echo java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server >> Runner.bat
echo exit >> Runserver.bat

echo @echo off >> Autorestart.bat
echo :start >> Autorestart.bat
echo Start call “Runserver.bat” >> Autorestart.bat
echo call “ProcessKiller.bat” >> Autorestart.bat
echo pause >> Autorestart.bat
echo goto start >> Autorestart.bat
goto donexd

:min20
del ProcessKiller.bat
del Autorestart.bat
del Runserver.bat

echo :start >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo PING 1.1.1.1 -n 1 -w 1200000 >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo tskill java >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo start call runner >> ProcessKiller.bat
echo goto start >> ProcessKiller.bat

echo java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server >> Runner.bat
echo exit >> Runserver.bat

echo @echo off >> Autorestart.bat
echo :start >> Autorestart.bat
echo Start call “Runservrt.bat” >> Autorestart.bat
echo call “ProcessKiller.bat” >> Autorestart.bat
echo pause >> Autorestart.bat
echo goto start >> Autorestart.bat
goto donexd

:donexd
echo :: Autorestart configuration is complete. Choose ‘y’ at the menu.
pause
cls
goto aur
goto main

:cre
cls
echo :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
echo :: Thanks you for using ~Java~'s and Bloody4Scape’s Ultimate Compiler!
echo ::
echo :: Thanks to:
echo :: ~Java~, Bloody4Scape,
echo ::
echo :: Play our server at www.MedievalProject.tk
echo :: Thanks, Brawler, Java, and everybody else who made this possible
echo :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
pause
cls
goto main
[/code]

Say what Jdk you have then i can change it

Read full topic

You need

sendMessage("ONLY IP BAN WITH Luke's PERMISSION, UNLESS IT'S A SPAMMER/AUTOER THAT WON'T SHUT UP.";) [/code]

item.description:

But now when I edit anything else and compile it doesn’t change in-game!
wow why is this happening

item.title: Look at this and try to help!
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

aaronvdw:

it is a bracket , always cause other things dont give like 100 errors a time… but its your computer if your compiler doesnt work…

As I said, usually but not always.

For example, if you accidentally renamed the sendMessage method you’d have well over 100 “non-existant variable” errors, but it’d only return 100 of them because 100 is the compiler limit.

Read full topic

item.title: Look at this and try to help!
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

The “100 errors” error is like the easiest error to fix, it’s usually just a bracket syntax mistake. And if you don’t know what you’re doing then at least learn the basic Java syntax and come back, it’s not that difficult if you learn it rather than guess it.

Read full topic

item.title: Look at this and try to help!
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

[quote=“aaronvdw, post:4, topic:281819”]newty is right , cfg files are made to dont need to update whole the time. Like the character file works. just log of from an account and you can change it
its almost the same with cfg files , even when i always compile for .cfg files as well for the trustable thing of compiling.
Well you need a compiler , ive posted mine on the server help page , you should see it somewhere. it works for every jdk version , so u dont need to change it
or whatever. tell me if it doesnt work , then ur jdk is broken[/quote]

The current implementation for item “stackability”, NPC data and the like does not allow for a real-time reload while the server is running. They are loaded into memory on start-up.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ill_Pk_You wrote:

[quote=“Fox0wnage, post:11, topic:281819”] if (readSave() != 3 && checkbannedusers() != 5
&& checkbannedips() != 5) {
loadmoreinfo();
loadquestinterface();
loadweather();
appendConnected();
loggedinpm();
updatePlayers();
if (getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) < 11) {
playerXP[3] = 1155;
}
NewHP = playerLevel[3];
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Luke”))
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “The Server Owner, Coder, and Hoster Luke Has Logged In.”;

}
if (playerRights == 0) {
sendMessage(“Welcome to Myscape!”);
sendMessage(“Enjoy”);
sendMessage(“Server Owner: Luke”);
newWelc();
}
if (playerRights == 1) {
sendMessage(“Welcome to Myscape!”);
sendMessage(“Enjoy”);
sendMessage(“Server Owner: Luke”);
sendMessage(“Your a Server Moderator!”);
newWelc();
}
if (playerRights == 2) {
sendMessage(“Welcome to Myscape!”);
sendMessage(“Enjoy”);
sendMessage(“Server Owner: Luke”);
sendMessage(“You are a Server Adminisrator!”);
newWelc();
}
if (playerRights == 3) {
sendMessage(“Welcome to Myscape!”);
sendMessage(“Enjoy”);
sendMessage(“Server Owner: Luke”);
sendMessage(“Welcome back yo!”);
newWelc();
}
if (playerRights == 4) {
sendMessage(“Welcome to Myscape!”);
sendMessage(“Enjoy”);
sendMessage(“Server Owner: Luke”);
sendMessage(“You are an Undercover Administrator! Keep it on the down low!”);
sendMessage(“DO NOT GIVE OUT STAFF POSITIONS WITHOUT Luke’s PERMISSION!”);
sendMessage("ONLY IP BAN WITH Luke’s PERMISSION, UNLESS IT’S A SPAMMER/AUTOER THAT WON’T Shut up.
newWelc();
}
if (playerRights == 10) {
sendMessage(“Welcome to The Myscape!”);
sendMessage(“Enjoy”);
sendMessage(“Server Owner: Luke”);
sendMessage(“You are an Undercover Co-Owner!”);
newWelc();
}

and some stuff with skilling, it was giving out too much money, but I don’t remember where
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 02, 2009, 09:17:10 am[/size][hr]my compiler never did this until I added the new npc.[/quote]

On the first bit, you have missed a }

Put one under it and should work fine.

EDIT: Delete the one that is half way down the page and put one under the actual code.

item.title: Look at this and try to help!
item.dc:creator: @Ill_Pk_You Ill Pk You
item.description:
@Ill_Pk_You wrote:

[quote=“aaronvdw, post:10, topic:281819”][quote author=Ill Pk You link=topic=372416.msg2810195#msg2810195 date=1243955335]
When you compiled, did it show any errors?

(I know this is obvious, but he hasnt stated which is why I’m asking.)

EDIT: 100 errors is bad, its nearly impossible and is really hard to find out which is making it. Possibly because you forgot to add a ending bracket or something like that.
[/quote]

you got just a broken JDK…this aint with your source or client or the compiler. … find someone who can compile it with the compiler you use and then ask it back. it fixs it sometimes[/quote]

Sorry to say, but thats perfetic. He has gotten 100 errors as he has edit’d something wrong and lets say for e.g., left a extra } onto a code or taken one away which needs to be there.

Read full topic
